intro: Petrocosmea bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its strikingly contrasting pink and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky and limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are small but vibrant, often blooming in clusters during the spring season. Petrocosmea bicolor is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also studied for its ecological role in high-altitude ecosystems.
